text: Leuculodes lephassa is a moth in the Doidae family. It was described by Druce in 1897. It is found in Mexico. The fore- and hindwings are semihyaline white, the former with the costal margin slightly yellowish. The head and antenna are yellowish-white and the thorax, abdomen and legs white.botanicus.org ==References== Category:Moths described in 1897 Category:Doidae
title: Leuculodes lephassa
